Package appointmentmaker

Class Reports

java.lang.Object
appointmentmaker.Reports
public class Reports extends Object
This class contains functions designed to generate 3 main reports.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Reports()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.collections.ObservableList>
    appointmentsReport()
    Generates a report of the total number of customer appointments by type and month
    javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.collections.ObservableList>
    appointmentsSchedule()
    Generates a schedule for each contact in your organization that includes appointment ID, title, type and description, start date and time, end date and time, and customer ID
    javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.collections.ObservableList>
    customerDemographic()
    Generates a report detailing the current customer demographics, showing how many customers live in each country that the organization works with.
    void
    setColumns(javafx.scene.control.TableView<javafx.collections.ObservableList> table, int type)
    This function populates the reports page tableview with the correct column names
    void
    setConnection(Connection conn)
    This function sets the connection to the database used in the reports

      public Reports()

  • Method Details

    • setConnection

      public void setConnection(Connection conn)
      This function sets the connection to the database used in the reports
      Parameters:
      conn - the database connection

    • appointmentsReport

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.collections.ObservableList> appointmentsReport()
      Generates a report of the total number of customer appointments by type and month
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of all the returned appointments

    • appointmentsSchedule

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.collections.ObservableList> appointmentsSchedule()
      Generates a schedule for each contact in your organization that includes appointment ID, title, type and description, start date and time, end date and time, and customer ID
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of all the returned appointments sorted by contact

    • customerDemographic

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.collections.ObservableList> customerDemographic()
      Generates a report detailing the current customer demographics, showing how many customers live in each country that the organization works with.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of all customers sorted by country

    • setColumns

      public void setColumns(javafx.scene.control.TableView<javafx.collections.ObservableList> table, int type)
      This function populates the reports page tableview with the correct column names
      Parameters:
      table - the table whose columns are being modified
      type - the type of report being displayed. 1 is the appointmentsReport(), 2 is the appointmentsSchedule(). 3 is the customerDemographic().
